SEARCH
Package gw.api.rest

Interface RequestContext

public interface RequestContext
The RequestContext holds information relevant to a single REST API request. Any API handler method can declare a parameter of type RequestContext and will automatically be passed the RequestContext at runtime.

  • Method Details

    • getRawRequest

      jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest getRawRequest()
      Returns the raw HttpServletRequest associated with this request.

    • getRawPathParameters

      Map<String,String> getRawPathParameters()
      Returns the set of raw path parameter values extracted from the request path.

    • getBodyAsString

      String getBodyAsString()
      Returns the body of the request as a String.

    • getRawQueryParameterNames

      Set<String> getRawQueryParameterNames()
      Returns the query parameter names found in this request.

    • getRawFormDataParameterNames

      Set<String> getRawFormDataParameterNames()
      Returns the formData parameter names found in this request.

    • getRawQueryParameterValues

      List<String> getRawQueryParameterValues(String name)
      Returns the raw String value(s) for the query parameter. The return value will be null if the query parameter doesn't appear anywhere in the query String, an empty list if the parameter appears without a value, and otherwise will be a List of values that the parameter has.

      For usage in code, consider using getQueryParameterValue(String) instead if you'd like to retrieve the deserialized value rather than raw String values

    • getRawHeaderValue

      String getRawHeaderValue(String name)
      Returns the raw String value for the given header. The return value will be null if the header was not included in the request. If the header appears multiple times, this method will return the header values joined together by commas.

      To retrieve the value of a header that's explicitly declared in the schema as a header parameter, consider using getHeaderParameterValue(String) instead to retrieve the deserialized value of the parameter.

      Note that header names are always case-insensitive.

    • getRawFormDataParameter

      Object getRawFormDataParameter(String name)
      Returns the raw form data parameter.

    • getQueryParameterValue

      <T> T getQueryParameterValue(String name)
      Returns the deserialized query parameter value, rather than the raw String value. This will return null both for query parameters that appear with no value and for query parameters that don't appear at all; if a parameter is allowed to appear with no value, use hasQueryParameter(String) to differentiate between those two cases. Not available in (@link gw.api.rest.IRestDispatchPlugin#handleReceiveRequest(gw.api.pl.rest.RequestContext))

    • hasQueryParameter

      boolean hasQueryParameter(String name)
      Returns true if the specified query parameter exists at all in the request, false if the parameter did not appear on the request's query string.

    • getPathParameterValue

      <T> T getPathParameterValue(String name)
      Returns the deserialized value of the given path parameter. Not available in (@link gw.api.rest.IRestDispatchPlugin#handleReceiveRequest(gw.api.pl.rest.RequestContext))

    • getHeaderParameterValue

      <T> T getHeaderParameterValue(String name)
      Returns the deserialized value of the named header parameter. Note that this method does not work for arbitrary request headers, and only works for header parameters that are listed explicitly as part of the operation.

      Note that header names are always case-insensitive. Not available in (@link gw.api.rest.IRestDispatchPlugin#handleReceiveRequest(gw.api.pl.rest.RequestContext))

    • getFormDataParameterValue

      <T> T getFormDataParameterValue(String name)
      Returns the deserialized value of the named formData parameter.

    • hasFormDataParameter

      boolean hasFormDataParameter(String name)
      Returns true if the specified query parameter exists at all in the request, false if the parameter did not appear on the request's query string.

    • getResponseContentType

      MediaType getResponseContentType()
      Returns the negotiated content type of the response

    • getRequestContentType

      MediaType getRequestContentType()
      Returns the request content type, as specified in the Content-Type header of the request

    • getRequestStartTime

      Date getRequestStartTime()
      The timestamp for when the request was received

    • getPathTemplate

      String getPathTemplate()
      Returns the templated path string that was matched for this request, if any. For example, if the swagger schema has a base path of /contacts/v1 and the path item has a path of /contacts/{contactId} and the incoming request is to path /contacts/v1/contacts/cc:123, then the templated path will be set to /contacts/v1/contacts/{contactId} Not available in (@link gw.api.rest.IRestDispatchPlugin#handleReceiveRequest(gw.api.pl.rest.RequestContext))

    • getOperation

      SwaggerOperation getOperation()
      Returns the operation info that will execute this request. Not available in (@link gw.api.pl.rest.IRestDispatchPlugin#handleReceiveRequest(gw.api.pl.rest.RequestContext))

    • getApiFqn

      String getApiFqn()
      Returns the fully-qualified name of the swagger schema that published this API, if any. Not available in (@link gw.api.rest.IRestDispatchPlugin#handleReceiveRequest(gw.api.pl.rest.RequestContext))

    • getLogger

      @NotNull @NotNull org.slf4j.Logger getLogger()
      This method will return the logger to use for logging within this request context. It can be overridden if a different logger is desired from IRestDispatchPlugin plugin.
      Returns:
      the logger (See Logger}

    • setLogger

      void setLogger(org.slf4j.Logger logger)
      This method will set the logger to use for logging within this request context.
      Parameters:

    • pushCloseable

      void pushCloseable(AutoCloseable block)
      This will add a block to be executed upon completion of the request.
      Parameters:
      block - the block to execute.

    • isAsync

      boolean isAsync()
      Returns true if the request is being processed asynchronously on a separate thread, indicating that the request was made with the `Prefer respond-async` header. Note that if the request fails early or completes fast enough, the client may still experience the response as synchronous, so this flag indicates that request is being processed via the async handling path on a separate thread, but does not indicate that the client will definitely get a 202 reponse code.
      Returns:
      true if the request is being processed asynchronously

    • isPreloadRequest

      default boolean isPreloadRequest()
      Returns true if this is a request initiated as part of REST servlet preloading
      Returns:
      true if this is a request initiated as part of REST servlet preloading

    • getPreloadRequestId

      default String getPreloadRequestId()
      Returns the request id if this request represents a preload request
      Returns:
      the request id if this request represents a preload request
